concept.title: Character Limitations for Variables
concept.shortdesc: All variables are populated with alphanumeric values that are reported in the interface. The limitations for characters in those variables are as follows.

ul.li: All: ASCII characters from 0-127 (do not use ASCII codes above 127 unless multi-byte characters are enabled and the s.charSet variable is populated appropriately)
All: Do not use tab (0x09), carriage return (0x0D) or newline (0x0A) characters
All: Do not use HTML tags ( or â„¢)
s.products: Do not use semi-colon (;) or comma (,) except to separate the elements
s.products: Do not use commas or currency symbols
s.products: Do not use the equal sign (=), except to assign numerical values to events
s.products: Do not use a vertical pipe (|), except to delimit events.
s.hierX: Do not use the delimiter (usually the slash character, "/"), except to delimit the levels of the hierarchy
s.events: Do not use commas, except to separate multiple events
s.events: Do not use colons (:), except to separate event from the serialization value

entry.p: Also, do not use any reserved characters that would cause problems with the JavaScript. For example,

breaks JavaScript execution. because the browser interprets the string as ending with the double-quote after "12." All JavaScript variables are URL encoded by the JavaScript before being passed to the data collection engine. It is not necessary to URL-encode the variables.

ul.li: s.pageName: 100 characters
s.propX: 100 characters
s.campaign: 255 characters
s.eVarX: 255 characters
URL: 255 characters
Referrer: 255 characters
s.hierX: 255 characters total; no specific limit for individual levels
s.purchaseID: 20 characters
Event serialization: 20 characters
s.products: 100 characters for category and product name (each); no overall limit to s.products string
s.events: no overall limit

entry.p: All versions of the IE browser impose a 2,083-character limit on all URLs, including the Adobe image request. This limit means that the sum total of all variable values (plus variable names) in the request cannot be more than 2,083 characters.

Long variable values, particularly in the s.products and s.events variables, which have no specified overall limit, can cause the Adobe request to exceed this 2,083-character limit, which suppresses the request, causing no data to be recorded.
